newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-MARINERS' MANZANILLO HAS SURGERY TO REPAIR TESTICLES.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-MARINERS' MANZANILLO HAS SURGERY TO REPAIR TESTICLES.

text.p: Seattle Mariners pitcher Josias Manzanillo underwent successful surgery late Wednesday night to repair tears in both testicles, the team said Thursday.
It was originally feared Manzanillo might lose his right testicle after being hit in the groin by Manny Ramirez's line drive Tuesday in a game against the Cleveland Indians.
Manzanillo, who was not wearing a protective cup, is now expected to make a complete recovery and will begin throwing in approximately two weeks, the team said.
The 29-year-old Manzanillo has appeared in five of the Mariners' first seven games, posting an 1.42 ERA with no decisions.
The Mariners placed Manzanillo on the 15-day disabled list Wednesday and replaced him on the roster by calling up left-hander Tim Davis from (AAA) Tacoma of the Pacific Coast League.
